content.description: The line below Primacy. Follow the pockets and ledges without touching the chossy rail above you, moving left to right, with a big move to pick up the same top out as Challenge to Primacy. Most people will find themselves a bit crunched

The best climb at Clarks currently IMO. The crimps are amazing beyond belief. Start in the double holds of Llamathrust, and traverse to the opposite side of the flat section and ascend. The obvious choss ledges are off, crimps only traverse
content.protection: 3 pads and a spotter, sketchy landing
content.location: Left side of the Gulley. If you walk to the fallen boulder and look left you'll see a section of wall that is clear of moss. That's it

content.description: Start hands on lower ledge, the footwork is the challenge on this one, avoid putting a foot on the large rocky ledge to your right. Bump left hand to great crimp, right to solid hold, then bump left and match in a great pocket jug above. Finish on nice clean ledge. please be mindful of insect and moss inhabitants of this area. Boulder is named after one of them.
content.location: Very clean noticeably flat face on the left side gully, follows similar line to the finish as Challenge the primacy, and Override the sun, but starts directly bellow instead of a traverse.

content.description: Start in the double holds, move right to the amazing crimp on the flat, drive for the ledge and then top out. Top out is cruxy, be ready for it

Bouldering on the left side of Lake Gulley, largely centered on the one clean face with sculpted holds reminiscent of the Red River Gorge.All the lines here avoid the chossy rail at eye-level, and the mossy blocks and stacked boulders on the right side of the traverse.
